clinical_study.brief_title: Fatty Acid Taste Thresholds: Caproic, Lauric, Oleic, Linoleic, Linolenic
clinical_study.official_title: Fatty Acid Taste Thresholds: Caproic, Lauric, Oleic, Linoleic, Linolenic

brief_summary.textblock: Differences in human oral sensitivity for caproic, lauric, oleic, linoleic, and linolenic acids will be explored. Prior work indicates that there may be a learning effect in measuring detection thresholds for free fatty acids. This study is designed to determine the number of visits necessary to attenuate this learning effect and also to test whether this effect continues across different types of fatty acids or is specific to each fatty acid. This will aid in understanding how many visits are required to obtain reliable data and if less expensive fatty acids can be used to attenuate learning before testing thresholds for more expensive fatty acids.

primary_outcome.measure: Oral sensitivity to oleic, lauric, linoleic, linolenic and caproic acids measured by the ascending 3 alternative forced choice test as described in American Society and Testing and Methods E679
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at weekly intervals over 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Thresholds for taste of each fatty acid will be determined using the 3 alternative forced choice test. Participants will taste 3 samples, one of which contains a fatty acid, and select which sample they believe is different. The concentration of fatty acid used will range from very dilute to a maximum of 5%. The test is repeated over the range of concentrations until a participant is able to correctly identify the fatty acid or until the maximum concentration is reached.

secondary_outcome.measure: DNA sequence of potential fatty acid receptors (e.g., CD36, GPR120, GPR48)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This will be collected at the final visit of the study, approximate 2-3 months from participant enrollment depending on how frequently the participant is able to come to the lab
secondary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected to analyze any correlations between fatty acid receptor genes and sensitivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of habitual dietary fat intake
secondary_outcome.description: A survey will be administered to determine each participant's habitual dietary fat intake

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This will be measured at every study visit (21 visits plus 1 screening visit) over the 2-3 months of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate how hungry they are on a line scale because commencing each study threshold test

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva will be collected to obtain DNA for analysis of genes for fatty acid receptors and their potential correlation with sensitivity.

study_pop.textblock: Individuals between 18 and 60 years of age from any ethnic background who are in good health and are available for the next three months will be eligible.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-60 years of age
- in good health
- available for 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in a different fat taste study in previous 6 months
